member.name: T:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebDateEdit
member.summary: Web control specialized for editing the date and time. C1WebDateEdit control renders a date editor.

member.name: T:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit
member.summary: The main Web control used for entering and editing information of any data type in a text form. Supports data formatting, edit mask, data validation and other features. Supports formatted and masked editing of all data types, including additional functionality. Apart from being the main data editor control, C1WebMaskEdit also serves as the base class for specialized controls such as C1WebDateEdit and C1WebNumericEdit.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.Common.C1WebInputBase.TextAlign
member.summary: Alignment of the text in the input box.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.Common.C1WebInputBase.CellSpacing
member.summary: Spacing between the border and buttons.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.Common.C1WebInputBase.UsedCulture
member.summary: CultureInfo object that is currently used by the control.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.Common.C1WebInputBase.Culture
member.summary: CultureInfo object. Each culture has different conventions for displaying dates, time, numbers, currency, and other information. Neutral cultures are not supported.
member.remarks:
Returning value can be null if Culture is not defined.
The CultureInfo class specifies a unique name for each culture, based on the RFC 3066 standard for Windows Vista and later, and the RFC 1766 standard for pre-Windows Vista operating systems. The name is a combination of an ISO 639 two-letter lowercase culture code associated with a language and an ISO 3166 two-letter uppercase subculture code associated with a country or region.

member.summary: Allows smart input behavior.

member.summary: If true then disable browser response on the ENTER key.

member.name: M:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.#ctor
member.summary: C1WebMaskEdit constructor.

member.name: M:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.Render(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Render the control.

member.name: M:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.OnPreRender(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: OnPreRender. Register client script.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.AllowPromptAsInput
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether PromptChar can be entered as valid data by the user.
member.remarks: Even when AllowPromptAsInput is true, the prompt character must be valid for the current location in the mask in order to be accepted. For example, if PromptChar is "*", and the current location in the mask demands the user enter a digit, entering an asterisk (*) will fail.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets the input mask to use at run time. Mask must be a string composed of one or more of the masking elements, enumeration parts, or numeric ranges.
member.remarks: For a list of masking elements, see the Defining C1WebMaskEdit topic.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.HidePromptOnLeave
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the prompt characters in the input mask are hidden when the C1WebMaskEdit loses focus.
member.remarks: Returns true if PromptChar is hidden when the C1WebMaskEdit does not have focus; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.PasswordChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the character to be substituted for the actual input characters.
member.remarks: Mask property must be non-empty for the PasswordChar property to take effect. Another option is to set UseSystemPasswordChar, which will show all displayable characters as password chars.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.UseSystemPasswordChar
member.summary: Indicates if the displayable text in the control should appear as the default password character.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.PromptChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the character used to represent the absence of user input in the control.
member.remarks: A prompt character is placed in editable positions that have not yet been assigned an input value. The default is an underscore (_).

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.ResetOnPrompt
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how an input character that matches the prompt character should be handled.
member.remarks: Returns true if the prompt character entered as input causes the current editable position in the mask to be reset; otherwise, false to indicate that the prompt character is to be processed as a normal input character. The default is true.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.ResetOnSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how a space input character should be handled.
member.remarks: Returns true if the space input character causes the current editable position in the mask to be reset; otherwise, false to indicate that it is to be processed as a normal input character. The default is true. ResetOnSpace is useful when assigning text that was saved excluding the prompt, where the prompt is replaced with a space. Before restoring such a string, setting ResetOnSpace to True will reset the prompt characters at the positions occupied by spaces in the input string.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.ShowHintForEnumParts
member.summary: Specifies whether to show hint with list of available enumeration values for enumeration parts in mask.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.SkipLiterals
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is allowed to reenter literal values.
member.remarks: Returns true to allow literals to be reentered; otherwise, false to prevent the user from overwriting literal characters. The default is true. Masks can contain literal and editable characters. If an attempt is made to add an input character to the position in a mask occupied by a literal, the value of the SkipLiterals property determines the result.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text as it is currently displayed to the user.
member.remarks: Returns text without any prompts and literals.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.TextWithPrompts
member.summary: Gets the text input by the user as well as any instances of the prompt character.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.TextWithPromptAndLiterals
member.summary: Gets the text input by the user as well as any literal characters defined in the mask and any instances of the prompt character.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.TextWithLiterals
member.summary: Gets the text input by the user as well as any literal characters defined in the mask.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebMaskEdit.InvalidInputColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used to identify invalid input.
member.remarks: Property omitted if Color is Empty. Default value is Empty.

member.name: M:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebDateEdit.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor of C1WebDateEdit.

member.summary: Register client scripts before render

member.name: E:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebDateEdit.DateChanged
member.summary: DateChanged event. Fired when the Date was changed.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebDateEdit.DateFormat
member.summary: Date format pattern.
member.remarks: The default value is d.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebDateEdit.DateFormatResultPattern
member.summary: Resulting Date format pattern.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebDateEdit.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets the DateTime value.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebDateEdit.StartYear
member.summary: Value of the starting year for the smart input year calculation. If a single digit greater than "5" is entered then it is considered as the year of the previous century.
member.remarks: If the user sets the starting year for the "SmartInputMode" property to work as "1900". So even if the user enters the "5" then the year will be "1/1/1951". And if the user enters the starting year as "2000" then if "5" is entered, then the year will be "2051". Range to interpret the date is 100 years, which is if the starting year is "1951" then the ending year will be "2050". So if "5" entered is followed by "1" then it refers to the previous century, and if it is followed by "0", then it refers to the current century.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebDateEdit.NullText
member.summary: Text that will be displayed for null date.
member.remarks: The default value is "Enter a Date value".

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebDateEdit.ShowNullText
member.summary: Show Null Text if the Date value is empty and the control loses its focus.
member.remarks: Minimal date "01.01.0001 00:00:00" used as null date. The default value is false.

member.name: P:C1.Web.C1Input.C1WebDateEdit.Text
member.summary: Text representation of the date value.

member.remarks: Default alignment for date editors is Right.
